publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1987 Bristow Muldoon: National Tree Week—That the Parliament notes that National Tree Week will take place from 24 November to 5 December 2004; welcomes the Tree for All initiative, launched in Livingston on 18 November 2004; recognises that it will see 2 million trees planted across Scotland by children and for children, contributing to a better environment around schools and towns and actively using woods to educate children in maths, English language, science and art and design; welcomes the positive impact that these actions will have, and urges individuals, schools, local authorities and communities to get involved.
S2M-1987 National Tree Week (lodged on 10 November 2004) Jackie Baillie*

S2M-1987 Bristow Muldoon: National Tree Week—That the Parliament notes that National Tree Week will take place from 24 November to 5 December 2004; welcomes the Tree for All initiative, launched in Livingston on 18 November 2004; recognises that it will see 2 million trees planted across Scotland by children and for children, contributing to a better environment around schools and towns and actively using woods to educate children in maths, English language, science and art and design; welcomes the positive impact that these actions will have, and urges individuals, schools, local authorities and communities to get involved. Supported by: Jackie Baillie
S2M-1987 National Tree Week (lodged on 10 November 2004) Irene Oldfather*, Dr Elaine Murray*
S2M-1987 National Tree Week (lodged on 10 November 2004) Maureen Macmillan*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-1987 National Tree Week (lodged on 10 November 2004) Nora Radcliffe*, Ms Rosemary Byrne*
S2M-1987 National Tree Week (lodged on 10 November 2004) Helen Eadie*
S2M-1987 National Tree Week (lodged on 10 November 2004) Iain Smith*
